data.title: Dinner with Daughter
data.text: The restaurant was small and cozy. The food was excellent as was the service too. Good wine selection.

data.title: Convenient and comfortable
data.text: I gave Basta 4 stars based on comfort, atmosphere and location.  I was disappointed in getting cold bread and having fruit flies land on everything.  Food was just ok to me, but there were others there raving about it. You will need a reservation since it's so small.  I noticed people getting annoyed about how long there service was taking as well.

data.title: Great Italian
data.text: Visited the night before running a half marathon. They were very accommodating on my wife's requests for some slight changes to suit her diet. The pasta was magnificent! Highly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Charming  little bistro for Italian food
data.text: Happened to where we parked our car and just walked in. I normally wouldn't go to a organic food place as organic food is a con job and cause less crops. Less production of food equals world hunger. . Food for three of us was excellent ,but a third meal was a little heavy. I definitely will go back again despite the organic food. Our waitress actually was almost the best part of the meal. Good Italian food and inventive.

data.title: Tasty family style bistro
data.text: Basta has good food...a bit pricy.  The atmosphere is very inviting and the owner is very involved in the service and making you feel welcome.  I would give it a try.

data.title: Quaint, warm and just lovely
data.text: This is a very small Italian restaurant. We were two couples on a Saturday evening. Some of our dishes were fried calamari, shrimp with lime (exactly like the photo on the Web site),  zuppa de pesce (with just a hint of spice but not fra diavolo), and linguine bolonaisse.  Everything was excellent. Service was perfectly in tune with our pace and friendly. This is a little gem. We will go back.

data.title: ITALY
data.text: Definitely the best place to try Italian food outside of Italy...the use the right olive oil and all the other ingredients could match the European standard easily. I was really yimpressed...

data.title: Cozy, intimate setting
data.text: This tiny restaurant serves great authentic tasting Italian food with simplicity and great service. The food was fresh and well prepared, especially the home-made pasta. It has a great vibe and unfussy decor, and is conveniently right across from the New Haven Green and Yale campus.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Been to Basta several times and never disappointed. At the table for latest visit we had Capesante Zio (Sea Scallops), Chicken Parm, Salmon and the "Sunday Dinner". All great! Save room for desert too. Creme Brûlée and Mounds Bites (a dark chocolate and coconut delight).

data.title: Real Italian sophisticated food
data.text: Me and my boyfriend were in Basta in first day of our visit in New Haven. Although it is not so cheap we are coming back there all the time. Food is delicious! I am in love with Basta's seafood.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Great pasta in cozy setting. Longstanding for a reason it's great. Sunday dinner is a classic. Service excellent. Small

data.title: Solid, Italian food
data.text: We stopped by Basta after a day of shopping for suits and it did not disappoint. Depending on your preferences, there is a lot of options--some healthier than others. You can't go wrong with a salad (w/ chicken, fish etc.) or just chicken in general. Great food.

data.title: reliably delicious
data.text: In a town filled with good italian places, this one is among the best.  the wine and service are good like the food.  Quiet atmosphee

data.title: Felt too expensive for the food quality
data.text: Definitely a nice atmosphere and a nice looking restaurant. But for the price of the dishes, I didn't feel like we got all that much. All the dishes (we were four) were pretty average, on our opinion, and didn't justify the prices. Good wine list, though.

data.title: Dinner before the show
data.text:
Wonderful food. Sea bass was delicious.   The calamari was the best I ever had 
Cute place with 12 tables    Great service and want to come back

data.title: Small space, big flavour
data.text:
We heard about Basta from friends. We went late and got a table. What a wonderful dinner. We had a great red wine, their salad special ( strawberry, goat cheese and pecan in a mixed salad with a dressing that perfectly married the flavours), the Branzini piccata and the lasagna special. Along with dinner they served a creamed artichoke and bean spread with the bread.
Throughout our dinner the service was spotless. They were pleasantly helpful and then knew when to leave us alone. Our mains were served together. The restaurant atmosphere was warm and very comfortable.
Our only regret was that we were too full for dessert- another day.

data.title: Make sure to put Basta on your NH food tour!
data.text: My friend and I walked in a couple of hours before the dinner rush was suppose to start, and we got seated immediately. You definitely need a reservation to eat here, because there is a limited number of seating. Our server was polite and friendly. As for the food, my seafood stew was absolutely amazing. It was one of the best Italian dishes I've had in New Haven.

data.title: Incredible food and excellent service!
data.text: My wife and I love Basta and whenever we visit New Haven from Indianapolis to visit our son who's attending school, we only eat at one restaurant every night we're here.  Valarie was our server this evening and she, like everyone else here, made us feel at home and like family.  My wife and I started with Basta's award winning meatball appetizers (see pic) and we were not disappointed!  Here's a Basta hack that Valarie recommended and is NOT on the menu, but should be.  Order the Linguine Aglio E Olio and then ask for them to add chicken and dried tomatoes to it!  Unbelievably delicious!  My new favorite! Ten star service, cuisine, and friendliness!  Basta is our favorite Italian restaurant and has our highest recommendation!

data.title: Cosy Italian restaurant
data.text: Just a tiny Italian restaurant on the main street of New Haven,maybe 2-3 tables outside the street.Great food with great wine and great servic.The pricing is reasonable .Highly advisable for couples and family.

data.title: Great Dinner, Even Gluten Free
data.text: I stopped at this restaurant by chance and it proved to be a great experience.  This is a very small restaurant that cooks very good meals that feel individually prepared.  I have Celiac Disease and the staff was very knowledgeable.  I selected a meal that was prepared specially for me and it was amazing.  Unique for gluten free.  My wife's meal was ordered right off the menu and was just as good.  I love the small feel of this restaurant and the staff was great.  I will definitely be back.
